column4: Hi... did my first ubuntu install ever. First experience with debian ... very limited experience with Mandrake Linux. I tried to run an AVI- file but got the following message: Totem could not play file due to missing decoders. What should I do?
take a look at wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats
does sound in other applications work?
e.g., do you hear the startup ubuntu sound when you login?
...yes
i have normal xine, not totem-xine, but i can try to help
is there a 'settings' menu, or maybe 'Edit -> Preferences', something like that ?
yes
well, totem-xine
hmm
sorry, i don't have totem-xine, and it looks like installing it will remove totem-gstreamer, and i don't want to do that
let me see in plain xine can play avis -- one moment
you need to use backports for those, i think
wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats should tell you how
heh. it's a web address
hmm, sorry, that page doesn't mention w32codecs
try ubuntuguide.org
and Threaputic: Thank you I will do some reading, and hopefully I don't have to come back to bother your.
cmatheson: you need to 'sudo chown -R weiers /home/weiers'
these problems are most likely because of residual mandrake gnome cruft in your /home/weiers directory
reinstalling might be easiest; you could also try erasing (or renaming) directories and files like ~/.gnome2, ~/.gconf, ~/.gconfd etc.
this would be from a text-mode console, after you've logged out
